definition: fate is unfavorable (idiom); the omens are not good
our luck is in, everything is going smoothly (idiom)

sentences.english: Triumphing over Death, and Chance, and thee, O Time.
sentences.chinese: 最终战胜了死亡，时运，还有你，时间。

sentences.english: None of the great composers had a more unfortunate talent-to-luck ratio than Franz Schubert.
sentences.chinese: 从没有一个伟大的作曲家像舒伯特那样的时运不济。

sentences.english: The moles and birthmarks in these areas can indicate good fortune, or a lack of it.
sentences.chinese: 痣或胎记落到这些区域有可能象征好运或时运不济。

sentences.english: It's said that Yang's royal family would have it's time by then.
sentences.chinese: 据说当时时运将至，新昌皇族即将有出头之日。

sentences.english: It worked against Forlan. It should work in favor of Suarez.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰时运不济，但现在的时机非常适合苏亚雷斯。

sentences.english: To all appearances he was just the commonplace planter who had fallen upon evil days .
sentences.chinese: 表面上看来，他完全是个时运不济的普通种植园主。

sentences.english: Your luck improves with the improvement of yourself.
sentences.chinese: 时运随着你自身的改善而改善。

definition: the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
our luck is in, everything is going smoothly (idiom)
to make easy money/to make a fortune/to line one's pockets
